comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Why this thread if there is already one that was opened by the owner and is in the Bitcoin discussion? I know you mention a lucrative idea in this whole project, but the question is, can the owner expect some kind of extra profitable business or is it just something he does out of pure passion for Bitcoin?

comments.author: Moneyprism
comments.body: it's very interesting to see how bitcoin is actually used in real world transactions.. but what concerns me is how is it regulated? did the local government not reprimand this place for not using the pound sterling? .. i'm really interested about that

comments.author: fiulpro
comments.body: The only way where people would take this idea on a global level is when they will start having cards with Bitcoins in them which they can spend in real world without paying anything else since Visa is honestly taking over, there have been bad time for visa cards as well but at the end of the day the popularity depends on how well you are able to handle the whole demand of the public and provide better rates. Now we do have cards that you can load with Bitcoins but only available in big countries and they are also charging some membership fee, but then again more options are coming over and people are changing as well. Let's see how far we can take it, we can always make paper wallets and exchange them for things, just an idea it would just be a physical bitcoin, like cash.

comments.body: Quote from: 348Judah on September 19, 2022, 11:03:00 AMWhat They Offer What I wish they would offerPrecious Metals ExchangeA booth for buying and selling precious metals like gold, silver and platinum. HODL assets.Scrap Metals ExchangeA booth for buying and selling normal metals like copper, aluminum, steel. HODL assets.Commomdities ExchangeNot certain on the regulation or legality. But it would be very cool if they had a market where commodities could be bought and sold in lower quantities than the typical delivery size which may only make commodities trades accessible to accredited investors or those who already have sizable assets.GPU, ASIC, PSU mining equpimentBuying and selling of GPUs, ASICs, PSUs and other equipment and software for crypto mining.Plant and Tree ExchangeIf food shortages hit. Plants and trees could become HODL assets....Inflation protection being one of bitcoin's main selling points. It could make sense to structure conditions around that theme if the goal is to create a place in Satoshi's honor.

comments.author: STT
comments.body: That would require security because those goods could add up to alot quite easily but facilitating trade would be a positive so long as people are able to get there fairly easily.   It would be a more involved operation as deals can easily go bad by accident or after a while (some) people will try to take advantage.    I used to go to a place like this in the early days of the internet and they made more on the drinks and food then anything else, ironically just having a point to draw people in was the main money maker;  we mostly used the computers offline lol

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: It's a Lucrative idea but if a restaurant's promotional policies are purely Bitcoin based they should change their marketing plans or else they will shut down quickly.Holding the events while the restaurant is operating normally with the possibility of paying in all other ways, and then organizing weekly workshops and celebrations will make the place unique and attractiveI will later check out their site.
